text: From high above, we look straight down a FOREST OF TOWERI PINES standing in a field of moonlit snow. We glide over the treetops, floating just above their pea as a light snow falls, the flakes corkscrewing lazily awa All seems peaceful, silent. Then we notice a strange light playing against the fresh powder. Red, then blue. Then red again. We crest a final stand of trees to reveal: AN ENTIRE ENCAMPMENT OF LAW ENFORCEMENT, some three hundred or so police, fire and ambulance, situated in what appears to b the middle of nowhere. From this angle, directly overhead, the SQUAD CARS and SW VANS almost look like toys. Nothing moves. The POLICE OFFICERS and SWAT Team members, hunkered down in firing positions, point their weapons at something unseen. We tilt from our isolating top-down view to reveal that t paramilitary phalanx is surrounding: a MODEST FARMHOUSE. It's a standoff of some kind, clearly. Then we see an ANT-SIZED FIGURE moving urgently across th frozen tableau. We slowly zoom in on the ant, revealing h to be a MAN IN A WINDBREAKER. We move with him now, tracking a FOLDED NOTE that he carr in his hand, as he brings us to a TACTICAL TRAILER with a seal emblazoned on the door:
The Windbreaker Man enters and we go with him...
...moving through the narrow trailer, past HIGH-TECH OBSERVATION EQUIPMENT manned by SPECIALISTS, to a BACK DO The Windbreaker Man opens the door to reveal a
(CONTINUED)

and a NEGOTIATOR on the phone, flanked by the HOSTAGE RES COMMANDER ("HR1i") and the ON SCENE COMMANDER, the man running the show. The Windbreaker Man hands the On Scene the folded note. H reads it and nods. Meanwhile, the Negotiator works the phone in a last ditch attempt to talk this through... -.-yes, I do. And I

hear what you're saying. I would be angry too. But you have to listen to me now. This has gone on long enough and it needs to end, okay? Can you help me here? Help me find a solution so we can end this peacefully for you, for your family, for everyone. We don't want anyone to get hurt -- and I know you don't want to hurt anyone. (beat) Ray? Ray?
Clutching the phone to
his ear is RAY HUTCHINSON (38), bearded, muscled and looking like he hasn't slept in days

You don't want to hurt anyone? I'm already hurt. You hear me? I'm already hurt. (beat) You say you're giving me a choice but this isn't a choice. Ending this peacefully means I go to prison and my wife and my kids grow up without a father? me? That's what you're offering (beat, deciding) I want everyone gone. You and your men, and the snipers too, all of "em -- gone. I don't see tail lights in the next five minutes, I'll end things my Ray hangs up and turns FRIGHTENED FAMILY: his old SON. All three of counter, backs pressed way. away from us, revealing his WIFE, his DAUGHTER and his six year- them hunkered down below the kitchen against the cabinet doors. (CONTINUED)
RAY (cont'd) It's alright. Everything's gonna be alright now. I promise. Ray moves to a HEAVY CHEST and throws it open, staring at what's inside. A grim look washes over his face.

location: TAC OPS COMMAND TRAILER / COMMS ROOM

text: The Negotiator looks up gravely from dial tone in his han The On Scene looks to HR1.
Gold Unit is in position. They have compromise authority and are at ready green. We're set, sir.
(re: the note) 7th floor approves escalation. (to the Negotiator) Can you get him back on the phone?
He's done talking.

(beat) Very well. The On Scene exits the COMMS ROOM and moves into the main trailer where he picks up a headset. ON SCENE (cont'd) Gold Unit, this is "Tock", be advised you have control. Repeat, you have control.

The REFLECTION in the farmhouse window shows SWAT UNITS backing off. Ray's request, it seems, has been met. The window curtains crack to reveal Ray watching the acti We drop down from the window and pivot off of Ray to reve THE FARMHOUSE YARD. A blanket of snow, some bushes, a woodpile. (CONTINUED)

We hold on this frame -- but nothing happens. A moment more. Still nothing. Then... One of the BUSHES moves. Then part of a WOODPILE seems to detach. And a section of snow right in front of us this whole time, rises revealing itself to have GREEN EYES. And now we see it: a SIX-MAN FBI HRT ASSAULT TEAM moves f their camouflaged hides and stacks up tight against the w just below the farmhouse window. They slough off their elaborate camouflage, revealing eac man to be kitted out in body armor and loaded for bear. We land on the team leader, WILL FORD, a seasoned operato Will speaks softly into his comm...

Gold Unit in position. Will looks at his second in command, his best friend and man we'll know later as HORACE. Will nods. Horace moves, setting a heavy-duty BREACHING CHARGE on the farmhouse wa Finished, Horace slides back into position giving Will th thumbs up. Will nods and begins the countdown... WILL (cont'd) Five, four, three, two, one... Execute. Execute. Execute. Will depresses a THUMB PLUNGER, igniting the breaching charge -- BANG! The sound is deafening as the wall explod leaving a gaping hole of smoke and dust in its wake. Will rushes in, primary through the door. We go with him, pushing through the thick haze to find
standing there, his back to us. Will and Horace go to gun on him, their sites leveled, fingers poised on triggers. WILL (cont'd) Turn around! Show us your hands!
Do it! Now! The rest of the HRT UNIT fans out near Will, securing the mother and daughter who won't stop screaming. (CONTINUED)
Slowly, Ray turns to face Will revealing that he's HOLDIN HIS SIX YEAR-OLD SON in his arms -- the boy's head wedged into the crook of his father's neck. HORACE (cont'd) Boss...
Hold your fire. (to Ray) Put him down. Ray hesitates. Horace grips his M-4, staring down it.
+..-I've got him clean... The boy's eyes lock with Will's.

No. Don't. I got this. Will turns to Ray, speaking with authoritative calm... WILL (cont'd) Ray, look at me. Look at me. It's over now. It's over. Put your son down, get on your knees and interlace your fingers behind your head. Do it now. Ray takes it all in, the madness he's caused. The pain.

I'm sorry. Ray lets his son slide off of him to the ground, revealin something horrifying: RAY IS WEARING A SUICIDE VEST. Will's eyes go wide -- he dives for Horace, tackling him behind the KITCHEN COUNTER just as: THE VEST DETONATES. boom. A ring of tinnitus in our ear. Screaming. Will, disoriented, catches glimpses of his team shattered -- de or dying. A living nightmare. (CONTINUED)
The horror of it washes over Will: his call to hold fire cost the lives of those he cares about most in this world his team, his men, his brothers. Devastated, Will mumbles over and over...

No-no-no-no... Sound falls away. Everything goes to white. We're in a hallway now somehow. The strobe of overhead florescent lights rushing past us. Then a face looks down at us. A Naval surgeon we'll come know as SARAH. She smiles at us and says...
You're gonna be okay.

A sun-dappled city park. Green grass. Trees. A little creek babbles nearby. Two kids, seven year-old fraternal twins, HENRY and GEORGIA argue about what to play: hide & seek or tag. Georgia gets her way: they'll play tag. We find Will, older now, a sadness behind his eyes. But sitting on the grass watching the children play, he can't help but smile.
She takes after you, you know. Will turns to see his beautiful wife, Sarah, the surgeon saved his life, enjoying the moment with him.
You think?
Oh yeah. Stubborn. Too hard on herself. Cries during sports movies.
I don't cry during sports movies. (CONTINUED)
Will laughs.
Rudy.
Well, come on. It's Rudy.
Field of Dreams.
Everyone cries at Field of Dreams--
A League of Their Own.
That was one time. And I was on medication.
Benedryl.
Extra strength -- and fine, maybe she's got my personality. I'm just glad she got your looks.
Me too because you'd make a really ugly woman. Like if we put a dress on you, the only thing missing would be neck-bolts.
Hang on -- back up. Did you call me stubborn?
You are stubborn.
Since when?
Since always. Now say it.
Come on. I got it.
Then let me hear you say it. (CONTINUED)
Who's being stubborn now?
I'm being insistent. There's a difference. Besides, don't you want to make a good impression?
Not really.
I'm serious, Will. It'll go a long way with him -- it's a cultural thing. Just say it.
Fine. (beat) Hen gaoxing de wen ni. It's Cantonese. And it actually wasn't that bad...
That's great.
Really?
Perfect. Perfectly done. The intonation, the enunciation. A+.
Thank you. See? I'm not stubborn. I can be taught.
One thing though.
What?
I taught you how to say: Hou hoi sam sik dou nei, "It's an honor to meet you." But you said, "Hou hoi sam sek dou nei."
And what does that mean? (CONTINUED)
It's an honor to kiss you.
Ah. And that's bad?
Depends on what kind of meeting you wanna have.

Alright -- I give up. No more Chinese. I've gotta get ready. Will stands up calling out to the kids... WILL (cont'd) Henry! Georgia! Time to go! The kids look at their father. Georgia capitalizes on the distraction, tagging her twin brother...

Tag! You're it! ...then bolting. Henry cries foul and gives chase. The tw kids run toward their father with abandon. Will smiles. Georgia reaches Will first, wrapping her arms around her father's leg... GEORGIA (cont'd) Base! Dad's base! I'm safe! ...and that's when we see that Will's right leg isn't mad of flesh and bone but rather metal and plastic -- a PROSTHESIS FROM THE KNEE DOWN. A scar he bears from that fateful night ten years ago. Henry arrives grabbing hold of Will's other leg.
Safe!
I'm already safe, you can't be safe too.
Yes I can.
That's stupid. (CONTINUED)
Hey -- not nice. And your brother's right. You're both safe. Daddy is safe for everyone because-- WHOA! -- suddenly Will jumps a foot as Sarah dumps an entire bottle of water down his back.

Tag you're it! Sarah takes off running, laughing. Will gives chase, his kids squealing with delight at their parents playing. Will catches Sarah, planting a big kiss on her before she tickles him and trips him to the ground, falling on top o him as both Henry and Georgia join in: a dog pile on dadd Will lets himself get pinned, laughing -- in heaven. It's then that we PULL BACK from this idyllic familial scene, past the grass and the trees and the babbling broo We continue pulling back, further and further still, unti we reveal something shocking. This park isn't in a city. And it's not in a small town. This entire THREE ACRE PARK exists on the 100TH FLOOR OF TALLEST BUILDING IN THE WORLD. A newly completed, three-thousand foot tall work of stunn architecture called THE PEARL rises gracefully from shoreline of VICTORIA HARBOR, dwarfing the surrounding skyline. We're in... Hong Kong Then a SOOTHING VOICE...
Welcome to The Pearl... Quickly, we find ourselves in a highly polished PROMOTION VIDEO...
+..a marvel of modern engineering. Standing at over three-thousand feet, The Pearl's 225 stories make it the world's tallest building... (CONTINUED)

We get our first good look at this work of art: a TOWERIN TWISTING, SKYSCRAPER with an OPEN-AIR CENTER CORE running its entire length, from top to bottom, giving the structu an airy, sunlit translucent grandeur. SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) ...it's so tall, you could fit the Empire State building inside of it twice! And you'd still have room for a 50 story building on top! -- B-roll of construction and slick computer generated fl through designs fill the frame. SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) Completed just last year, China's newest beacon of progress boasts a five-star hotel, three full gyms, two 16-screen cinemas, a driving range, as well as world-class shopping and dining at its six-story indoor mall and three star Michelin-rated restaurant with rotating views of the spectacular Hong Kong skyline -- all within its confines... -- we see cutaways of each feature, happy people enjoying every amenity. SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) ...And that's just half the story! A DIVIDING LINE bisects the building halfway up... SOOTHING VOICE (cont'd) Next month, The Pearl will open its upper half to permanent residents -- already sold out, with a ten year waiting list, these luxury apartments will serve as home to many of China's most successful citizens. With Pangu Park -- the world's first fully functional high rise garden -- located on the hundredth floor, residents will have their every possible need met, from outdoor sun to indoor fun -- you'll never need to leave The Pearl! It's then we PULL BACK to reveal we're...  12.
A stunning three-bedroom apartment on the 98th floor with jaw-dropping views. Henry and Georgia are transfixed by t television playing the promotional video...

But that's not all. The Pearl's crowning achievement -- the singular feature that makes this building unlike any other, anywhere else in the world is... ..-but just before we reveal what that might be, the TV c off. Henry and Georgia turn to see Sarah standing there.

TV goes off, shoes on. It's Panda Time! Excited, Georgia zips up her PANDA HOODIE, pulling the co over her head, turning her into a mini-Panda bear. SARAH (cont'd) Nice, Georgia. Subtle. (beat) Where's your dad?
Bathroom.
He's talking to himself again.

Dressed nicely, Will ties the laces on his BROWN WINGTIP. Only the shoe is facing him on the bathroom sink counter, attached to his PROSTHETIC LEG -- a handy way to do it. He talks to himself in the mirror as he goes, practicing Chinese phrase over and over, stumbling every time. Will shakes his head muttering to himself...
Screw it. I'm just gonna high-five the guy. Finished tying his shoe, Will uses a Kleenex to wipe off smudge on it, then tosses the tissue paper into the toile (CONTINUED)

Will attaches his prosthesis, sliding his pant leg down o it. He goes to flush the toilet but can't find the handle -- there doesn't seem to be one. It's a mystery. Will looks at a BIZARRE ARRAY of touchscreen buttons next the toilet -- none of which look like "flush". He presses one and gets a BIDET SPRAY right in the kisser. One cue, Sarah walks in.
Everything okay in here?

Yep, just thought I'd take a shower in the toilet. Sarah walks over... WILL (cont'd) It's broken. We should call-- .В»..and presses a button, the toilet flushes normally. WILL (cont'd) I was gonna pick that one next.
Sure you were, big guy. Sarah fixes Will's outfit, drying him off, fussing over h SARAH (cont'd) Hey -- you think it's weird that we're the only ones on this floor?
We're the only ones on any floor from the 96th on up -- so not really.
No, I mean why not put us up in the hotel in the bottom half? Why give us an entire ghost town floor to ourselves?
I don't know -- maybe he's trying to impress us.
You think a billionaire, real estate tycoon is trying to impress us? (CONTINUED)
You think I'm reaching?
I think you drive a Kia. So, yeah.
I'm just saying: don't over-think it.
Have you met me? Will smiles, grabs his jacket, closes his LAPTOP and puts in his SHOULDER BAG. SARAH (cont'd) Horace is coming to get you?
Any minute now.
Can I just say one thing?
I doubt it.
Don't give him any money.
He's not going to ask me for money.
How do you know?

Because he's head of security for this entire building and they pay him for that. Will and Sarah move into the other room and tag-team gett Georgia and Henry ready, backpacks, shoes, etc. Will puts Georgia's hair into a ponytail, clearly he's had practice
And how much of that does he double down with? Will frowns. Moves toward the front door, Sarah follows. (CONTINUED)
That's not -- he doesn't have a gambling problem.
Not anymore -- you helped him.

Look, that was three years ago -- he got in over his head with the wrong kind of people. He would've done the same thing for me. He made a mistake -- we all make mistakes. (beat) And he's sticking his neck out for me. They could've gone with a higher profile guy to handle the security assessment but he put in a good word. He's the reason we're here -- and we could use the money.
You have a soft spot for him. That's all I'm saying. DING-DONG. Doorbell. They look at each other -- time's up SARAH (cont'd) You're a big dummy. You know that?
You married me.
I'm a sucker for handsome. Sue me.
Love you.
Love you too, neck-bolts. Will laughs. They kiss. The kids go, "Ewww". Will looks at his twins...
Okay team, daddy's gotta go make the bacon. But let me ask you one thing before I go... Will points to Henry. (CONTINUED)
WILL (cont'd) Daddy loves who?
Me! Will points to Georgia...
Daddy loves who?

Me! Will rapidly points between them repeating his question, each time they shout out, "Me!" at the top of their lungs Finally, Will kisses each of them on the tops of their heads. Sarah watches the sweet moment, sighing...

I gotta get a chant. Will winks at her, then moves to the door, opening it to reveal Horace his second-in-command from his HRT days and the only other member of the team to survive the blast. Nearly Will's size, with some telltale BURN SCARS on his cheek and neck, Horace offers up a big smile.
Brother.
Brother. The two friends embrace. The observant might notice Horace's right hand is severely misinformed -- mangled fr the explosion. The hug breaks and Horace spots Sarah...
Sarah -- you look beautiful.
Nice to see you, Horace. Sarah gives Horace a polite hug just as Henry and Georgia arrive. Horace can't believe it.
These are the twins? Wow -- are they driving yet? You guys remember your Uncle Horace? (CONTINUED)
No.
We're going to see the pandas.

Yes -- I heard. That's why I got you guys a little something. Horace pulls out a trio of GOLD TICKETS. HORACE (cont'd) These'll let you stay for the nighttime feeding -- after they close Ocean Park to everyone else. Very hard to get. He hands the tickets to Sarah.
That's amazing. Thank you, H.
What do you guys say?
Thank you.
Georgia?
Are you gonna ask my dad for money? Off of Will's look we move to...

Horace and Will move toward the cylindrical INNER ATRIUM The Pearl, an open-air center column that runs from the ground floor to the very top of the structure. The internal circumference is lined with a series of GLAS ELEVATORS and SKYWAY BRIDGES that span the vast opening, connecting various floors directly, giving the space the of a BRAIN STEM with synapses firing. Horace jabs the button, they wait. (CONTINUED)
Sorry about that. Georgia doesn't have a filter. Sarah thinks she takes after me.
Why, does she cry at sports movies too? DING. Elevator arrives. Horace and Will step on.

This GLASS ELEVATOR travels up the INNER ATRIUM -- a sphincter-clenching ride if you're afraid of heights. Will looks through the glass: elevators rise and fall, gleaming in natural sunlight. He marvels...
You hear that? Horace strains an ear. Shakes his head.
I don't hear anything.

Exactly. These are mag-lev elevators They work on magnetic induction -- like the bullet trains in Japan, only vertical. No cables, no wires, nothing. No one's ever built any that go this high. It's bleeding edge stuff.
Huh. No kidding.
How do you not know that?

They hired me to protect it, not give tours. But lemme guess: you spent the last six months studying every nut, bolt and blueprint of this damn place. Will looks away. Horace knows him too well. He teases... (CONTINUED)
HORACE (cont'd) Come on, tell me I'm wrong.
You're wrong. (beat) It was eight months. Horace shakes his head...
You know he's not gonna ask you to build the thing from scratch, right?
I like details.
Nerd. Will chuckles. HORACE (cont'd) Hey -- you hear they switched insurance guys on you?
No Singh?
No Singh. Singh go bye-bye.
Huh. They say why?
Official word, he got sick. Unofficial word, he got sick of the boss man's speeches.
He gives speeches?
You ever met a billionaire who doesn't?
I've never met a billionaire.
Well stick around, this is China -- we got a million of 'em. (CONTINUED)
Ding. The elevator doors open. They step off.
Horace leads Will across an opulent, sunlit private floor stopping at a pair of imposing DOUBLE DOORS.
(re: the doors) Wow -- those are them, right? The titanium doors from the blueprints?
Nothing says welcome to my penthouse panic room better than ten inches of military-grade super alloy.
Subtle. Horace holds his hand against a wall-mounted scanner.
Ready to meet Oz? The double doors swing open.

Horace leads Will past the foot-thick Titanium doors into penthouse to end all penthouses. Three floors, exquisitely designed, impeccably furnished offering up staggering panoramic views. This palace in th sky is fit not for a king, but a Pharaoh. Will takes it in...
I mean, I guess if you gotta live somewhere...
Right? Will notices a framed BLACK BELT and ceremonial CHINESE SWORD on the wall next to him.
He's a black belt? (CONTINUED)
In the same way Doctor Dre is a doctor. Heard he built them a brand new dojo after he "earned" it.
Hey -- Sarah thinks I should doa Chinese thing when I meet him.
Chinese thing?
Like say some words. A greeting.
In Chinese?
Cantonese. But yeah. You know, to show respect.
I wouldn't.
Why?
Because you suck at languages and you'll probably mess it up and embarrass yourself.
But other than that?

Mr. Ford. The moment interrupted, Will and Horace turn to see ZHAO (30s), a Chinese Elon Musk and the dashing visionary behi The Pearl, come gliding down a staircase toward them flan by a handful of SUITS and a discrete PRIVATE SECURITY DET
It's a pleasure to meet you. Zhao speaks nearly perfect English, a hallmark of his Oxf education. says... They shake hands. Will glances at Horace then
Hou hot sam sik dou nei. (CONTINUED)

Will nailed it. Zhao smiles, impressed. Horace is slack- jawed. Zhao rattles off a response in rapid-fire Cantones Finished, the billionaire waits expectantly on Will to answer. Will, of course, has no idea what Zhao just said. A pregnant pause, then Zhao lets him off the hook...
I'm kidding. Will exhales.
Oh, thank god. My wife only taught me one phrase.
Sarah, right?
Yes.
And your children, Henry and Georgia -- twins?
You do your research.
I've got a good team around me. But I wasn't aware that your wife speaks Cantonese. I thought she was a Naval surgeon.
She is. But she minored in language and East Asian studies at Annapolis. She was gonna work for Doctors Without Borders in rural China after her service.
What happened?
She met someone who needed her more. Zhao smiles. Just then, a stuffy British pencil-pusher, M PIERCE interrupts the moment. Zhao pivots to him warmly. (CONTINUED)
Mr. Ford, allow me to introduce Mr. Pierce from the Hawthorne/Stone Insurance Group, the company lucky enough to underwrite The Pearl. Mr. Pierce smiles thinly, extending his hand.
A pleasure.
Likewise.
Mr. Singh is ill.
I heard.
At any rate, I hope your family is enjoying their stay in Hong Kong.
We've got the whole floor to ourselves -- what's not to love?
Sorry if I went a little overboard -- I guess I was trying to impress you. (beat) Shall we begin? Zhao motions and the group moves off.

Zhao stands in front of a WALL-SIZED TOUCH SCREEN which displays a 3D rendering of The Pearl. Zhao rotates and resizes the display as he speaks. Will sits with his laptop open, Horace next to him. Opposite them, the THREE SUITS and Mr. Pierce.

...with our cutting edge solar arrays and proprietary wind-harnessing technology, The Pearl has a negative environmental footprint -- even at full occupancy, we'll actually give power back to the city. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

ZHAO (cont'd) (beat) The residential upper half, with our 24-hour surveillance & security, redundant off-site fire control systems, and on-site emergency medical staff, will be the safest, most luxurious living in all of China, if not the world. We even have our very own dedicated cell tower -- so you'll never miss a call even when you're a mile in the air. (beat) The Pearl is not just the future of China but it is, in a very real sense, The Future itself. The suits clap like ass-kissers. Annoyed, Zhao waves at them to cease. He looks to Will... ZHAO (cont'd) What do you think?
Me?
Yes, of course. Unsure of the politics of how to respond, Will goes with.
It's, uh, neat.
Neat?
Yeah, real neat. Mr. Pierce jumps in... Sick burn.

I think what Mr. Ford is trying to say is that it would be imprudent of someone in his position to make any comment whatsoever about The Pearl's qualities, aesthetic or otherwise. (beat) With all due respect, he's not much more than a glorified security guard. Will's jaw tightens. He gives Mr. Pierce a cold look but toes the party line... (CONTINUED)

He's right. I'm only here as a certified independent third party to assess your safety and security measures and, if they're compliant, sign off on them so Mr. Pierce's company can give you the thumbs up to officially open the top half of your building. It's not really my place to comment.
I know why you're here, Mr. Ford. And I know it's not your place to comment -- which is precisely why I'm asking you to. Please, your honest opinion.
It's been my experience that when people ask for someone's honest opinion, that's usually the last thing they want.
Humor me. Will glances at Mr. Pierce who gives him a stiff "go ahea nod. Will clears his throat.
Well, let me start by saying that what you've built here is truly incredible. You should be proud.
But...?
But...if it were up to me, I would never insure this building. Not ina million years. Mr. Pierce eyes Will sternly. The room tightens.
And why is that? (CONTINUED)

You've built a vertical city here, Mr. Zhao, which is impressive sure, but you've brought with it every single fire, safety and security challenge I can think of -- and you've not only brought them all indoors, you've trapped them three thousand feet in the air. (beat) Everything in this building has to go right every single time and too little has to go wrong once for there to be a very serious problem without a viable solution. (beat) Look, I'm a simple man. I like my beer cold, my wings hot and fireworks on the 4th of July. But if you're asking for my honest opinion about what you've built here, it would be this: I don't get it. Then Will looks at Mr. Pierce. WILL (cont'd) But, Hell, I'm just a glorified security guard. So what do I know? The room sucks in. Mr. Pierce shoots daggers at Will. But Zhao smiles and says with all sincerity...

Wonderful. Now I know I can trust you. Zhao pulls out a TRANSLUCENT FLASH DRIVE. ZHAO (cont'd) This drive contains the machine codes for The Pearl's fire and safety control measures -- a master key, if you will, to the entire building. They're linked to your laptop alone and, once installed, will only be accessible for a twenty-four hour window before self-deleting. I trust that will be enough time for you to thoroughly vet our security and submit your final analysis for Mr. Pierce's approval? (CONTINUED)
More than enough. Thank you. Zhao slides the FLASH DRIVE to Will who uploads it onto h laptop. A COUNTDOWN CLOCK ticks down from 24 hours. Zhao glides to the door and looks back expectantly...
Come on, if we hurry there's still time.
Time for what?
For you to get it. Zhao smiles. Will looks a little confused.
And finally we see it -- the crowning achievement of this incredible structure, and the very thing that gives the building its name:

encases the upper most echelon of The Pearl -- an observation deck fashioned entirely out of laser-cut crystalline glass whose triangular facets fit so perfectl one into the next, that they almost disappear entirely. What's more, the footprint of the glass deck itself exten beyond the profile of the building's rooftop allowing for the stout-hearted to walk out beyond the roof and look straight down to the ground, nearly a mile below. It's nothing short of breath-taking. We find Zhao and Will up here alone. Will takes in the sight dumb-founded. Zhao stares across the Victoria Harbo

I grew up over there, across the water on the Kowloon side. My father sold fish. His father sold fish and his father before him. So I grew up selling fish. Every morning up before the sun. Bone tired in the boat as it went down. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

ZHAO (cont'd) (beat) When I was six years old, our house was burned to the ground by some men my father refused to pay. They killed him that same night when he confronted them in the street. (beat) My mother raised me and my eight brothers in sisters in a one-room house smaller than my bathroom is now. At night, I remember staring at this very skyline through our window, as my brothers and sisters slept -- knowing someday I would make my mark, someday I would change what I saw out that window. And no one would ever take it from me.
I'm sorry for your loss. But why are you telling me all this?
Because you and I aren't so different from each other, Mr. Ford. We're both men from humble beginnings who shaped the world around us, not the other way around.
Yeah -- next time remind me to invite you to my skyscraper. Zhao chuckles.

TouchГ©. Zhao checks his watch then glances at the sun, doing a calculation in his head. ZHAO (cont'd) Walk out there and turn around. Unsure but curious, Will walks out onto the EXTENDED DECK the section. He turns back to face Zhao. ZHAO (cont'd) Once we open The Pearl, the place you're standing on right now will become the newest wonder of the modern world. A testament to what we can do. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
ZHAO (cont'd) (beat) Count to three and you'll see what I mean. Uncertain but game, Will plays along...

One...two...three. On three, the sun hits a certain point in the sky, its ra striking the geodesic dome just so, causing the light to refract perfectly, bouncing off of each precisely placed facet resulting in a jaw-dropping effect. Suddenly, as if by magic, the deck, the glass, the entire dome itself, everything -- COMPLETELY VANISHES. we see the flames ROAR UPWARD, like a living creature -- twisting tornado of fire thirsty for fuel and hungry for oxygen. The blaze climbs higher -- a kiln burning white-h
Ladies and gentlemen, I give you a 6.5 billion dollar chimney.
Lock it in. Some fancy keystrokes add an encryption code to the chang in the building, effectively making them permanent.

Encrypted. He pops up and hands Will's laptop to Xia. TECHIE (cont'd) You've got full systems control from that laptop and that laptop only. No pass code needed. Plug and play. Everyone else is locked out.
How long will it take them to crack your encryption and regain control?

I don't know -- seven hundred years? I'm the only one who knows the logarithmic base cipher I used to encrypt it, so I'm literally the only person on planet earth who can crack it. Pretty smart, huh? (CONTINUED)

Not that smart. THWIP! One silenced 9mm round to the forehead drops the Techie. She tucks her gun away and slides Will's LAPTOP into her messenger bag for safe keeping, pulling out a GLOSSY BLACK BRICK with a BLINKING RED LIGHT in exchange. The phone in the control room starts RINGING madly. She ignores it, placing the black brick on the doorjamb with magnetic CHUNK. She activates it and exits.
Xia moves away from the facility toward the front gate. S touches her ear, speaking to someone unseen...
Heading to on-site. The Tough Guy looks over from the GUARD SHACK...
We done?
Yep. THWIP-THWIP! Two shots in the ten-ring. He's dead before he hits the ground. She doesn't so much as break stride.

Choked with smoke. Licks of flame are visible through the exterior windows, reaching up from below. It's only a matter of time before the fire claims this floor as well. The door to the apartment opens, revealing Sarah sporting wet hand towel tied around her nose and mouth like a cowb She's cut a hole through the sopping bath towel for her head, wearing it like a poncho. She steps into the hallway, holding hands with Henry and Georgia who are dressed just like her: wet towel mask and poncho, giving the kids the look of tiny ghost bank robbe
Where are we going?

Zhao stares at his giant WALL MONITOR: every floor above 95th is BLINKING RED, the anti-fire measures all read as OFF-LINE. Clearly, something is rotten in Denmark. The suits are agitated. One sips a bottle of water, his hand shaking as he does. Mr. Pierce paces, nervous.
I thought you said the fire wouldn't spread. You said it would be contained. What's wrong with your building? Don't you have sprinkler systems?
Yes and the sprinkler systems on the 96th floor engaged as designed.
Really? Then why didn't the fire go out?
Because the water caused the fire.
Come again?

It's the only conclusion. And there's only one way water itself can cause a fire: through an exothermic chemical reaction. Which means this wasn't an accident -- it was arson. Dov, Zhao's body man, returns...
Local control is completely locked out and off-site's not answering. The entire system's been compromised -- our techs are trying to crack it. (beat) And there's something else.
What? (CONTINUED)
Our log codes show Will Ford's family swiped into their residence two hours ago, before the fire. That news puzzles Zhao, but he's got bigger fish to fry..
How long to get control of the building back?
I don't think they really know, sir.
What was their estimate?
Eighteen hours. The suit drinking the bottle water nearly chokes on it.
Eighteen hours?! We don't have eighteen minutes! This thing's burning like a match!
Matches burn from the top down.
Oh fuck you, Buddha! We need to leave!
You're missing my point. With the fire doors open above the fire and closed below them, this building isn't burning like a match -- it's burning like a kiln. It's super- heating.
Are you saying it'll collapse?
No -- The Pearl could burn to cinders and never collapse. Collapse isn't the issue.
Then what is? (CONTINUED)

The real issue is that the building doesn't know it's on fire. And if it doesn't know it's on fire, it can't act to preserve itself. Which means the fire will grow hotter and hotter and spread faster and faster until it has nothing left to feed on. Until it eats itself to death. Until it consumes us whole.
Fantastic. Wonderful. I think we've all learned something really valuable here today. I know I have. Now can we please get on the fucking helicopter?
You know what's interesting about you, Mr. Pierce?
What?
Nothing. Dov chimes in, speaking softly...

Sir, you know as well as I do that if the fire gets within twenty floors of us it will over-heat the air around the helipad making liftoff impossible. If we're going to evacuate, we need to do it now. Zhao weighs the situation. Then he makes his decision.
Alert the authorities that we'll be departing. With that, Zhao exits.
Zhao moves through his lavish bedroom and into his WALK-I CLOSET. Passing racks of $5,000 suits, he stops at the ba wall -- a PANE OF GLASS looks out onto the skyline below. (CONTINUED)

Zhao places his hand on the glass causing hidden scanners read his palm print. GREEN BEAMS shoot out from a secret source behind the glass and scan his retinas. Suddenly, the pane of glass reveals itself to be a clever constructed false wall -- it's a 6K LED SCREEN playing a VIDEO IMAGE of the skyline below. A perfect forgery. The LED PANEL opens inward. Zhao steps through it into...

about the size of a small bathroom. Zhao moves to an old school 1820's FLOOR SAFE and dials in a combination. He cracks it open, pulling the heavy door back to reveal single object inside: A TINY RED MEMORY CARD, the size of thumbnail. Zhao reaches for it.

Tumult as EVACUEES from The Pearl are directed this way a that way by EMERGENCY PERSONNEL. No one pays him any mind, which i just how Will Ford likes it. Will pauses and looks up at the burning skyscraper above him, the mountain he must climb to rescue his family. The sheer size of it takes his breath away. The task seems impossible. Will's mind races -- there has to be a way. Suddenly he spots the answer. He wheels toward us as we pivot around him to reveal a:
perched at the very top of an ADJACENT 90-STORY BUILDING still under construction. We hold a beat longer than we might as suddenly XIA STEPS INTO FRAME. She must've spotted Will. She moves after him

Will rolls into the alcove in his wheelchair, holding out paper cup, shaking it at him -- begging. The Police Officer scowls, then barks at Will in Chinese. But Will keeps at it shaking the cup. Finally, the asshole cop slaps the cup out of Will's hand and in a blink, Will grabs the man's wrist yanking him do into a vicious head-butt -- CRACK. The cop goes slack. Will catches him before he falls.

Sorry, pal. Next time maybe give a little. Quickly, Will hops up on one leg and swaps places with th police officer, dropping him down into the wheelchair and covering him up with his ball cap and tattered coat. Will places the cup in the cop's lap and pushes him forwa just as a PASSERBY tosses some change into the his cup. WILL (cont'd) Thanks. The English startles the Passerby but he keeps moving. Wi locks the wheelchair in place and pulls out his prostheti leg from the satchel on the chair-back, attaching it. Will pats the cop on the shoulder and moves off inside th building. Shots fired. Shots fired. Officer down. Request immediate back-up. Suspect Will Ford has entered the Scion Capitol building. Armed & dangerous. Flanked by his second-in-command, LIEUTENANT HAN, Captain Chan drinks black tea from a paper cup as he moves throug the Ops Trailer, keeping an eye on a series of MONITORS which play local news broadcasts of the unfolding event.

...Fire Chief says there's nothing he can do. Water pressure from the trucks can only hit the 30th floor, tops. The system crash shut down the standpipes in the building -- there's no way to get water up high enough.
So what's he saying?
He's saying it's gonna burn.
Get a team to that off-site control facility -- we need those systems back online.
Yes, sir.
What about the guy -- Will Ford. What do we know?
Marine Corps, Bronze Star, FBI for six years, Hostage Rescue Team for eight -- early retirement.
Early?
I guess there was an incident.
What kind of an incident?
We're not clear on it yet.
Get clear. (CONTINUED)
Yes, sir.
What about the other guy? The dead one in the bathtub.
Still no ID on him but medical examiner says he was killed eight, maybe ten hours beforehand.

So you're telling me this one-legged American war hero, travels thirteen thousand miles -- with his wife and kids who no one can seem to locate by the way -- to kill a John Doe this morning, dump the body in his FBI buddy's bathtub before offing him too and then, to kind of round out the evening, decides to light the tallest building in the world on fire? That's where we're at with it?
That's what it looks Like right now, yeah.
And the attack on the van -- the one that sprung him -- that's part of this?
Maybe. Maybe not.
Well I don't know about you Lieutenant, but I think we might win a medal for our police work here. Outstanding stuff. (beat) How 'bout this: is there anything we do know for sure?
Zhao's leaving his penthouse by helicopter. Got word ten minutes ago.
Well, thank god the billionaire's safe. (beat) Lieutenant? (CONTINUED)
Yes, sir?
Do me a favor? Go find Will Ford. I'd like to ask him some questions.
Yes, Captain. Lieutenant Han turns to go but...
Lieutenant.
Sir?

Never mind. Found him. Captain Chan points a large monitor where we see LIVE NEW HELICOPTER FOOTAGE of Will climbing the vertical spire of the super crane FROM THE OUTSIDE. CAPTAIN CHAN (cont'd) Send a strike team. An OPS TECH chimes in...
Already there, sir.

NEWS CHOPPERS circle, blasting Will with their SPOTLIGHTS he works his way, inch-by-inch, up the exterior scaffoldi of the 300-hundred foot tall super crane. ON THE CRANE SPIRE, Will mutters to himself...
Don't look down...don't look down... Will looks down -- the height is dizzying. His stomach drops. He curses himself... WILL (cont'd) Stupid. Then, at the base of the crane, Will spots: (CONTINUED)

rushing onto the roof, pointing their weapons up at him. Their TEAM LEADER hurries to the crane's ENTRY DOOR as th building's MANAGER unlocks it. The Team Leader throws ope the door and presses the call button for the CRANE CAR.

Two-thirds of the way to the top, Will watches as the CRA CAR descends past him. Will can't believe it... WILL (cont'd) Shit. There was an elevator? It's only a matter of moments before the elevator reaches the Strike Team on the roof. No (more) time for jokes, Wi redoubles his efforts, climbing feverishly. Just then, a JET BLACK POLICE HELICOPTER swoops down from the night sky like a bird of prey on the hunt.
we see a SNIPER, sporting serious-looking night vision goggles, readying his JS 7.62mm bolt-action long gun.

At last, Will pulls himself up and onto the CONTROL PLATF Exhausted by the effort, Will collapses flat on his back a second, breathing hard. It's eerily quiet up here. Will gets to his feet and looks at The Pearl. He's roughl 110 stories up -- above the fire line, above the park eve Will looks down to the rooftop and sees the STRIKE TEAM boarding the crane car. Will chides himself...

Great plan, Will. Way to really think this through. Now what, genius? He's got only seconds to do whatever it is he's planning do. Will spots the GLASS-ENCASED CONTROL CAR -- inside it panel of buttons and a joystick that controls the boom ar He moves to it, scanning the area looking for anything to help him break the door handle and gain access. (CONTINUED)

He spots a nearby TOOL CABINET. He rushes to it, yanking open to reveal a set of tools -- among them a SLEDGEHAMME Will grabs it and rushes back to the Control Car. He's ju about to bludgeon his way in when he thinks better of it and -- what the hell -- tries the door handle. Click. It opens. Will almost laughs. But the sound of the approaching elevator snaps him back into the moment. He rushes over to the platform's ELEVATOR CAGE, grabbing hol of a LENGTH OF CHAIN and a SCREWDRIVER along the way. Will slips the thick chain through a STEEL LOOP on the ELEVATOR CAGE DOOR, securing it with screwdriver. It'll s "em down, but only for so long. Will hurries into the

where he turns the crane on. After some quick and comedic trial & error and he's got the hang of it. Will rotates the BOOM ARM, swinging it toward The Pearl. Then he EXTENDS toward the face of the building. The cran BEEPS an alert -- it can't extend any further. A THIRTY FOOT GAP remains between the end of the crane and The Pea Will exits the Control Car just as the Strike Team arrive to find themselves locked in. Immediately, they go to wor on the door, trying to break the makeshift chain lock. Time running out, Will grabs the sledgehammer and hustles THE FAR END OF THE CRANE. He stares off the end of the diving board, looking at the building in front of him, calculating something in his mi Will moves back a few paces then charges at us, holding t sledgehammer high and screaming like a medieval warrior.. WILL (cont'd) Ahhh!!! Will HURLS the sledgehammer with all his might -- whoosh! The sledgehammer hurtles through the air, descending gracefully until it strikes the GLASS EXTERIOR of The Pea --CRASH!-- punching through the glass but not shattering sticking there. Will throws up his hands. (CONTINUED)
WILL (cont'd) Come on. Really? Clearly, that wasn't the plan.
The entire Ops Trailer as well as Captain Chan and Lieutenant Han watch the events unfold in sheer disbelief
Why the hell would anyone want to get IN to a burning building? Just then, an Ops Tech breaks in, listening to some chatt on his headset.
Captain -- word coming in right now -- we have a location on the suspect's family. But Captain Chan already knows the answer...
Don't tell me -- they're in the building.
Yes, sir.

Will turns from the edge and moves back toward the CONTRO CAR, when he's hit with a WASH OF BLINDING LIGHT. The Police Helicopter drops down, calling out a DISTORTED WARNING IN CHINESE over its loudspeaker as it swings its body broadside. The light peels away from Will revealing the SNIPER hanging out of the bay door. Will's eyes go wide -- BANG! -- a high velocity round cra an inch from his head. Will breaks for it, bolting down t boom arm -- running with everything he's got. The sniper fires again and again but Will's inside the scaffolding structure of the steel arm making the shot nearly impossible as two more rounds ricochet off metal. From directly above, the chopper chases Will down the cra arm's length, firing. (CONTINUED)
WHAM -- the elevator door slams open and the Strike Team rushes onto the platform, stopping short at the sight of:
running flat out toward the end of the arm, nothing but a thousand foot drop and certain death at the end of it.
inhales collectively as they watch this tiny figure race toward the end of the plank...

as he runs those final few steps -- no hesitation, no doubt -- to the end of the crane and then -- WHOOSH! -- h LEAPS OFF OF IT, kicking high into the air like an Olympi long jumper. Then... -everything slows down-вЂ” Silence. Wind rushes by our ears as we hang a hundred fee above the fire in the pitch black of night

hovers almost directly above Will, fifty feet up; its rot turning in timeless slow motion -- WHOOSH-WHOOSH-WHOOSH. Will begins to fall in a parabolic arc toward The Pearl - toward the window pane with the sledgehammer embedded in Aiming nearly straight down, the Sniper pulls the trigger
The bullet races at Will who's falling toward the window -- the HIGH VELOCITY ROUND RIPS INTO WILL'S LEFT SHOULDER

Will cries out as the 7.62mm brass tears through flesh an continues onward, piercing the EXTERIOR WINDOW -- shatter it completely -- a split second before Will hits that ver same opening -- THUD! Speed returns as Will slams into the newly-formed window ledge, the impact knocking the wind from his lungs. Glass rains down around him as the sledgehammer falls too its steel head hooking onto the window ledge. (CONTINUED)

Will falls back but, at the last second, he snatches the sledgehammer handle, dangling there by his one good arm, more than a hundred stories in the air. The crowd below GASPS! The sledgehammer starts to slide loose quickly. Will has choice but to use his other hand -- his injured arm. He throws it up there, grabbing hold of the window's ledg just as the sledgehammer dislodges, falling away. Will hangs by his damaged arm. Enduring ungodly pain, he manages to get his good arm on the ledge. Using both arms now, Will pulls himself inside the building. He made it.
the crowd goes WILD -- a folk hero is born.
No celebration. No quips. Exhausted, Will drags himself t his feet and staggers off into the building.
In the boardroom, Zhao and the others watch in astonishme
What the hell's he doing?
Apparently, whatever it takes. Dov enters and gives Zhao a look. ZHAO (cont'd) If you'll excuse me, please. Zhao exits as Mr. Pierce and the suits watch the news unfold.
Dov and Zhao step out of the boardroom, settling in. (CONTINUED)
McManus is instrument-rated, it's not his day job, but he's more than qualified to fly us out of here. I sent him up to get the bird ready.
Excellent. But Dov's face betrays him -- he's not saying something. ZHAO (cont'd) Is that it?
Sir, I've worked for you for nearly eight years now. In that time, I believe I've shown myself to be trustworthy and more than capable...
What's on your mind, Dov?
Sir -- I can't protect you if you don't tell me what's going on. This isn't a fire, this is a plot -- and I need some answers. Zhao knows his body man is right.
I can't say for sure.
I don't need facts. What's your gut telling you? Who's behind this? That name hits Dov hard.
Wu-Sai Jun.
Triads?
Black Lotus.
I don't understand, if the Black Lotus wanted you dead, there are easier ways. (CONTINUED)
They don't want me dead -- they want this. Zhao pulls out the RED MEMORY CARD. Just then...
Can we go? Zhao quickly pockets the memory card. But Mr. Pierce cloc it and senses that's he's interrupted a secret moment...
Is there something I should know?
Yes -- the helicopter's ready. Dov moves off, but Mr. Pierce isn't feeling too comfortab about whatever it was he just witnessed.

Flanked by Dov and his security detail, Zhao, Mr. Pierce, the suits approach the grand DOUBLE DOORS to his penthous Zhao places a palm on a wall-mounted HAND-SCANNER. The titanium double doors swing open. They exit.
Zhao and the posse move away from the penthouse's double step on to a PRIVATE ELEVATOR. The doors close. It goes u

Bizarrely, Will finds himself on a floor filled with LUXU STORES -- a high-end shopping mall in the sky. Bleeding on the imported Emperador marble floor, Will staggers past CARTIER, GUCCI and TOM FORD -- all closed. spots an abandoned JANITOR'S CART up ahead. He rushes to Will digs through the cart, looking for anything that mig help him. Quickly, he finds a roll of DUCT TAPE and a bottle of RUBBING ALCOHOL. Will inspects his gunshot wound: a grisly quarter-sized h in the meat of his shoulder. Not good. He rips his shirt sleeve off and rolls the fabric into a short tube. (CONTINUED)

Will unscrews the rubbing alcohol and dumps it onto his wound -- the sudden pain hits him like a wave. Will brace himself against the wall to keep from doubling over. A breath, then Will thumbs the rolled fabric into his wou end-first. The pain is enormous, but the deed is done. Th wound has been packed. Will grabs the duct tape.

If you can't fix it with duct tape... He winds it twice around the meat of his shoulder, tearin the tape with his teeth, securing the ad hoc bandage snug WILL (cont'd) ...then you aren't using enough duct tape. Will tests his arm. He can move it, but it hurts like a bitch when he does. It'll have to do. Will loops the duct tape to his belt and moves to the INN ATRIUM to get his bearings. All of the elevators are off- line due to the fire. NEWS COVERAGE plays on an in-wall T SCREEN -- from the looks of it, the fire is about to reac the park. Will talks to himself... WILL (cont'd) I'll find you. Just hang on. Will moves to the STAIRWELL DOOR, throwing it open only t stagger back as he's struck with a blast of heat and smok Will tears his other sleeve off, tying the fabric around face. He gathers himself and enters the

which is choked black by smoke. Will spots a RED EMERGENC BOX with a WOODEN PICK-HEAD AX inside. A sharp elbow is a it takes as Will grabs hold of a three-foot FIREMAN'S AX. He descends into the smoke.

Zhao's LUXURY HELICOPTER sits inside this two-story, glas walled, hangar in the sky. Then the GLASS WALLS slide apart like as the ENTIRE SECTI of glossy showroom floor that the helicopter rests on extends into the night sky like a plank on a pirate ship. (CONTINUED)
The rotors start to spin as the PILOT preps for take off. Zhao and the others exit the elevator onto the hangar flo

AN HKF ASSAULT TEAM moves through the open gate, clocking the dead bodies in the guard shack. They approach the low-slung concrete building, stacking u by the door. The BREACHER uses his METAL RAM to knock the doorknob straight through like a Whack-A-Mole -- THUNK! The Team yanks the door open and rushes in tripping an INFRARED BEAM and triggering the BLACK BRICK booby trap. KA-BOOM. A bone-rattling explosion.
Chaos. Phones ring, people shout as word of the explosion pours in. Captain Chan takes it all in with a grave calm. Lieutenant Han approaches, handing him a print out.
Got positive ID on the JD in the bathtub.
Who is he?
Sanjit Singh. Insurance executive for Hawthorne/Stone, the company underwriting The Pearl. Chan puzzles over this new piece of information as we...
standing in the penthouse hangar. He rolls up his shirtsleeve, revealing a FAMILIAR LOOKING TATTOO. We're..
The helicopter's rotors at speed, the pilot signals for Z and the others to approach. Zhao moves forward but Dov stops him short -- something isn't right. (CONTINUED)
Hang on --
What is it?
-- The pilot. He's not ours.

text: Pierce turns to Zhao and pulls the trigger just as Dov tackles his boss out of the way, catching a round. Instantly, it's a fire-fight. Pierce and his five men wit sub-machine guns versus Dov and his three men with handgu Caught in the crossfire, the suits are quickly dropped by the assailants as Dov and his squad take cover. where he unloads eight shots through the windshield, stitching the pilot in the chest. The pilot slumps forwar onto the controls CAUSING THE HELICOPTER TO LIFT AND TILT TOWARD THE HANGAR -- it only takes a split second for the blades to catch the helipad plank.

--BANG! Dov's voice is choked off as he's plugged in the chest courtesy of Pierce. Sir...
Not now.

Good evening, your Honor.
Pierce spots Zhao disappearing in his private elevator. H shouts at his men as he hurries toward the STAIRWELL DOOR slamming through it, racing to cut off Zhao's escape.

The elevator opens and Zhao bolts for his penthouse doors slapping his hand on the palm reader. Click -- the heavy doors open just as Pierce barrels thro the adjacent stairwell door, gun blazing -- BANG-BANG-BAN (CONTINUED)
Zhao slips through the narrow opening -- as Pierce's roun spark and ping off the doors. Zhao slams the EMERGENCY CLOSE button. The titanium doors shut on Pierce's face, locking him out.
Zhao breathes hard -- shaken. He reaches into his suit an pulls out the RED MEMORY CARD, staring at it in relief.
Pierce curses his luck. His remaining five men arrive. Furious, Pierce snatches a RADIO MIC off of one of them.
Open the penthouse doors!
Xia sitting at a street cafe a block from The Pearl touch her ear. [INTERCUT AS NECESSARY]

Standby. She opens Will's laptop, logging into The Pearl's control systems. She selects the penthouse but can't affect it -- she's locked out of its controls. Not good. XIA (cont'd) The penthouse isn't linked to the building's control system. He's got his own subsystem for his floor. I can't drive it -- I'm locked out. Pierce fumes, then doubles down.
Kill the power to the upper half. Cell tower too. All of it. Go dark. With a few clever keystrokes Xia cuts the power to the to half of The Pearl and disables its internal cell tower.
The gathered crowd OOHS & AAHS as suddenly the top half o The Pearl goes out like a Christmas Tree getting unplugge  76.
Zhao's penthouse is thrown into darkness. Emergency light CHUNK ON. He pulls out his cellphone: no signal.
Standing at the titanium doors, Pierce looks at his team.
How do we get in?
We can't. But I know someone who can. And he happens to be in the building.
The American? But we don't know where he is.
We don't have to know where he is -- we know what he wants. All we need to do is get to them first.

Sarah and the kids kneel by the stream in the park. Georgia, still sporting a soiled Panda hoodie, re-wets th towels in the ersatz lake. Henry coughs from smoke inhalation -- an asthma attack taking hold.

It's okay, baby. Just slow down. Slow down and breathe. In for three, out for three. Sarah gives him two hits from the inhaler and helps Henry calm his breathing, trying to get his attack under contro The MUFFLED ROAR of the unchecked blaze GROWLS from below leviathan rising. It's not safe.
How do you know-- BOOM! -- a FIRE DOOR on the far end of the park rockets o its hinges as flames reach through the new opening.

Run! Sarah hustles her kids through the park as from all angle the fire begins to claw its way into the floor. a narrow footbridge with a glass canopy that spans the diameter of the INNER ATRIUM. From above, we watch as Sarah and the kids race across th sky bridge; the world below them filled with ash and fire glowing like the mouth of a volcano.

text: they find respite -- this part of the park hasn't been consumed by fire yet. Sarah puts Henry down, spotting another STAIRWELL DOOR on the opposite wall. She's about make for it when, suddenly, it opens revealing FENG. The guy doesn't miss a beat -- he smiles warmly...

Building security. We met earlier, remember? Feng continues walking, closing the gap between them as Sarah subtly moves in front of her children. FENG (cont'd) You need to come with us now -- the building's not safe, we're evacuating. Feng reaches for Sarah, she steps back.

Miss -- please. We don't have time.
