Fine. You got it. He reaches to his belt and pulls out his H&K COMBAT PISTO FENG (cont'd) Let's go, bitch. Sarah's face falls. Feng grabs her, spinning her and wrapping a big forearm around her neck. FENG (cont'd) Kids too. Henry and Georgia start to tear up... (CONTINUED)
It's okay -- it's okay, guys. Just do what he says. Surreptitiously, Sarah slides her hands into her front pant's pocket, pulling out the pair of CHROME SCISSORS.
Listen to your mommy ki--AHHH! Sarah stabs Feng in the upper thigh -- he cries out -- an flips him over her shoulder in a slick judo move.

Run! Henry and Georgia take off running back across the sky bridge, as Sarah dives for Feng's H&K, snatching it up an turning back just in time to take a boot to the mouth. Sarah goes sprawling as Feng rises, yanking the scissors from his leg and tossing them aside. He picks up his pist but tucks it away and pulls out a TACTICAL KNIFE, spinnin it menacingly -- he's gonna do this old school. Sarah gets to her feet, unarmed and out-muscled. Easy prey in front of him, Feng attacks. But Sarah is mor than he bargained for as she side-steps his swing, blocki his knife arm expertly before kicking his knee out. Feng goes down hard, howling. Sarah turns and takes off running back across the sky bridge.

Holding hands, Henry and Georgia find themselves in the middle of a legitimate forest fire. In all the smoke and madness, they get turned around quickly -- burning trees everywhere. Henry starts coughing harshly, letting go of his sister's hand. And that's when a MASSIVE PIECE OF CEILING COLLAPSE Henry and Georgia dive out of the way just as the section smashes between them through up smoke and fire. Like a pilot in the fog, Henry gets turned around -- he can't see Georgia any more. He calls out for her. Nothing Unsure, he picks a direction and heads that way, calling for his sister.
(CONTINUED)

Henry comes toward us, coughing madly and calling out for Georgia. He doubles over at a PARK BENCH, trying to catch his breath. He's alone and terrified. And that's when he spots Sarah running across the bridge toward him.
Mom! Henry takes off running toward her.

Sarah races toward the far end when suddenly a BURNING TR from the park falls, crashing through the Inner Atrium gl wall and SLICING THROUGH THE SKY BRIDGE IN ONE CLEAN STRO A HAIL OF HOT EMBERS explodes as the END OF THE BRIDGE dr at a sharp angle, nearly taking Sarah with it. She turns back to see Feng hobbling toward her. He tucks away his knife and pulls his H&K. No more games. She's trapped. Sarah takes a step back, her heels dancing on the edge of the broken bridge and a fall to her death.

I wasn't supposed to kill you -- but I don't give a shit anymore. He's about to pull the trigger when suddenly his face goe slack. Then blood cascades down his chin and he face-plan to reveal a FIREMAN'S AX in his back and
standing there, ten feet behind him, having hurled the blade. Sarah rushes to him, they embrace.
Are you okay?
I'm fine -- how did you get here?
Tell you later -- we gotta get the kids.
They're back in the park. Will nods breaking into action -- he dislodges his ax and goes to snag Feng's gun when... (CONTINUED)

GUNFIRE rains down on the GLASS CANOPY of the sky bridge, shattering it. Two of Pierce's MEN three floors up unload Will grabs Sarah's hand as they take off toward the open of the bridge through the maelstrom, exiting:

head_text.subj: INTO THE FAR SIDE OF THE PARK

text: which has itself begun to burn. Will and Sarah hug the curve of the INNER ATRIUM wall, circling around counter- clockwise back toward the blocked end of the sky bridge..
Mom! Dad! There's Henry -- he was circling around clockwise toward them. Will and Sarah kneel down, hugging their son.
Where's Georgia?
I don't know! We got split up -- she's back in the park somewhere. Will and Sarah share a look -- they know how grave that i
I'll find her. We gotta get you guys outta here first -- they're coming down for us.
Will -- what the hell is going on? Who are they?
I don't know yet. The only thing that matters to me right now is getting you out of here. Will's eyes land on a nearby Inner Atrium Elevator. WILL (cont'd) Come on.
Lost and frightened, Georgia moves through the park. (CONTINUED)

She calls out for her mother and brother but, with the ro of the fire, her cries are quickly swallowed up. She spots a GLASS STAIRCASE cut into the exterior window wall of the building itself -- a tourist attraction featu BOOM! A FIERY SINKHOLE suddenly opens up in front of Georgia, the ground beneath her feet eroding. She back pedals from its lip and bolts for the glass staircase. Just as she disappears, we land on the TWO GUNMEN we last saw shooting at the skyway bridge. They spotted Georgia.
(into mic) We got the girl. He nods to his buddy, they move for the stairs.
Sarah and Henry are in the car, Will stands outside it.
I'm not doing this--

Henry can't stay in this building -- there's too much smoke. You know that. Whoever those guys are, they're serious. The only safe place for you both is on the ground. Will finds a WALL PANEL and cleaves it open with his ax revealing a complex array of cables and wiring. He digs through the cabling as he talks... WILL (cont'd) These elevators are Mag-Lev -- they work on electromagnetic induction. But in the event of a power failure, they're held in place by a hydraulic fail-safe brake. (beat) The power's out from the midpoint of the building on up -- but it's still on below the fire line. Once I cut the hydraulic cable, you'll fall.
will-- (CONTINUED)
Listen to me -- you'll fall through the fire and hit electricity again -- the magnets will kick back on and stop you. You'll be traveling too fast for the flames to matter. Trust me.
I'm not leaving you --

You're not leaving me, you're saving Henry. (beat) It's almost 1,000 feet from here to the fire line. That'll take you about nine seconds. Count to ten and then pull this emergency stop handle -- okay?
What about Georgia?
I'll find her. I promise. It's a solemn vow. And Sarah knows it's the only way. She kisses him.
I love you.
I love you too. Will hugs Henry. WILL (cont'd) I need you to be strong buddy -- take care of Mom, okay? Can you do that for me?
Yes.
Good. It's gonna be scary, but you'll be fine. Just hold on and count backwards from ten, okay? Henry hits his inhaler and nods. (CONTINUED)
Okay.
Daddy loves who?
Me.

That's right. Will hugs his boy, kissing his forehead. WILL (cont'd) Step back. They move back into the elevator, sitting down on the flo Will lines up his ax blade on a THICK YELLOW HYDRAULIC CA Will and Sarah lock eyes -- a look of love and strength between them. Then Will steps into a home run swing -- THWACK!-- a clean cut. Instantly the car plummets -- Sarah's SCREAM Dopplers awa as they disappear in a blink.
The ELEVATOR roars past us at 170 MPH -- a complete, stomach-dropping, free fall.

WARNING ALARMS BLARE as Sarah holds Henry in a bear hug o the elevator floor -- the world coming apart around them. They count backwards together: ten...nine...eight... The CARRIAGE SHAKES AND SHUDDERS as a staccato of light strobes the glass car -- fire then smoke, then fire again A descent into Hell itself. Seven...six...five... The elevator glass SHATTERS from the unbridled G-Force. Four...three... The centripetal force pinning her, Sarah reaches for the EMERGENCY HANDLE, fingers dancing across it but not quite
-Two...ONE! (CONTINUED)

She yanks the handle. Nothing happens. They keep falling. Sarah yanks the handle again -- then a loud CHUNKING nois as she's slammed to the floor, a SHOWER OF SPARKS explode all around the car. Finally the carriage chokes to a stop Sarah looks at Henry -- the boy smiles. They made it.

With its kitchen a concentric circle around the inner atrium, this fancy-ass restaurant offers up stunning 360В views of the Hong Kong skyline. The priciest meal in town What's more, the floor itself is comprised of GLASS PANEL offering up views of the park below. With the fire raging unchecked, the setting is lit with an unearthly orange gl We find Georgia standing in the middle of the space, breathing hard. Panic setting in. She hears a noise and spins to see the two GUNMEN rushing up from the stairs. Instinctively, Georgia ducks -- hiding a split second bef the men arrive on the scene. The Gunmen scan the restaurant. They know she's here. Gunman #1 motions to his partner, they split apart, stalk through the Michelin-rated finery.
It's okay -- we're the good guys. You can come out now, you're safe.

hiding under a table, is anything but convinced. She spot a STEAK KNIFE on the setting above her. She sneaks her fingers up to snag it -- her hand disappearing just as Gunman #2's eyes sweep that exact sp The Gunmen close in on her location, tossing over tables they go. Closer and closer to her hiding spot. Tension squeezes us like a vice as Gunman #2 stops in front of Georgia's table.
Georgia dare not breathe. She clutches her steak knife an spies Gunman #2's foot right in front of her. The young girl screws up her courage and drives the knife home. (CONTINUED)

Gunman #2 ROARS. Georgia bolts from cover. Gunman #2 FIRES -- but his pained shots are wild, lighting up glassware and cutlery all around Georgia as she dives beh the CIRCULAR KITCHEN WALL against the inner atrium.
Will, searching feverishly in the fire, hears the gun sho from above. He spots the glass staircase and breaks for i
Gunman #1 grabs Gunman #2's carbine, jerking it aside.
We need her alive! She's the bait.
She fuckin' stabbed me!
Get over it. He motions and the pair split up again -- each taking opposite entry points into

where Georgia crawls on all fours, staying low. She opens low STAINLESS STEEL CABINET and crawls inside, shutting i The hunters stalk their prey slowly, opening each cabinet they go -- it's only a matter of time. In the small darkness, Georgia begins to cry, terrified. Gunman #2 throws open Georgia's cabinet, revealing her.
Found you, you little shit. You're gonna pay for what you-- WHAM! Out of nowhere, Will freight trains him, sending Gunman #2 smashing him against the inner atrium glass.
(to Georgia) Go! She does as Will turns his focus to Gunman #2 who fires a point blank range. (CONTINUED)

But Will side-steps the shots, grabbing the muzzle and stitching the atrium glass panel with them before kicking Gunman #2 in the back, sending him through the panel and down to the first floor the hard way. Will pivots just as Gunman #1 opens fire on him. Will duc as pots and pans dance and pinwheel overhead. Gunman #1 goes dry and reloads allowing Will to grab a CA IRON SKILLET and, using it like a medieval shield, charge Caught between reloads, Gunman #1 jerks his sidearm and unloads into the iron plate, but Will is already on top o him -- the beat down is merciless. Will's about to end it when he hears...

Enough! Will turns to see Pierce standing there, holding Georgia, pistol to her head. All the fight goes out of him. For a moment, Will's confused -- the last time he saw Pie was in Zhao's penthouse boardroom. Quickly though, Will puts together the double-cross. His eyes narrow. Then he looks to his frightened daughter and reassures her...
It's gonna be okay, honey. The Gangster gets to his feet and drives the stock of his weapon viciously into Will's gut, dropping the big man to his knees -- Will never takes his eyes off Georgia.
Captain Chan moves down the length of the trailer, headin for the door, flanked by Lieutenant Han...
The Night Tigers are military -- counter-terror.
I'm aware of that, Lieutenant.
But this isn't an act of terrorism. (CONTINUED)

That's not how the his honor sees it. He sees an expertly-trained foreign national, wanted for murder, on the loose inside that building preparing to do god-knows-what. He's not going to take any chances.
And you agree with him?
It doesn't matter if I agree with him. It's happening. Chan exits...
...Lieutenant Han follows.
Captain...

There's nothing I can do. We've got thirty minutes to resolve this scenario or it becomes a military operation and we're on the sideline. So unless someone can tell me something different is going on inside of that building, they're gonna use a broadsword on it. Then:
Sir... Chan turns to see: an OFFICER standing there with SARAH A HENRY, dirty, blanketed, but alive.

Pierce holds Georgia at gunpoint. The young girl whimpers and shakes, tears rolling down her face, scared for her life. Flanked by Pierce's three remaining men, Will is on his knees, his hands zip-tied behind him. Will does his best to console his daughter... (CONTINUED)
Honey -- look at me. Look at my eyes. Everything's going to be alright. I promise. You hear me? Panicked, Georgia can only nod her head yes. WILL (cont'd) I love you, sweetheart.
(shaking) I love you too, Daddy.
I'm afraid I'm going to have to interrupt. Will glares. If a look could kill, Pierce would be toe-up
The dead man in Horace's bathtub -- Singh -- that was you?

No -- that was your pal. That's the nice thing about dealing with degenerate gamblers, they'll do anything to pay a debt. Even sell out their dearest friend. Now -- you still haven't answered my question.

I already told you: the only way that door opens is if Zhao opens it from his side or if this floor's fire alarm triggers it -- but that can't happen because you guys took the entire system offline. You understand? It can't be done.

Nonsense. Anything can be done with the proper motivation. So let me help. You're gonna get in there and you're gonna bring Zhao, and what he's holding, to me or I'm gonna throw your daughter off the fucking roof. Pierce grabs Georgia's arm, shaking her sharply. (CONTINUED)
PIERCE (cont'd) I hear it's like heaven up there.

Daddy! Will lunges to his feet, charging at Pierce. One of Pierc MEN cracks him on the skull, sending him to the floor. Will coughs and writhes, his eyes watering. Pierce shoves Georgia to one of his men, then he moves over to Will, kneeling down to cut his zip tied hands, smirking as he d

Tick-tock... Pierce grabs Georgia by the hair and yanks her toward the STAIRWELL EXIT DOOR. The girl yells for her father -- Wil reaches out for Georgia from the ground, a futile gesture Pierce and his men disappear through the STAIRWELL EXIT. His daughter's cries cut short as the door seals shut. Will gets to his feet, shaking out the cobwebs. He moves the stairwell door, trying it with no luck -- it's locked He starts pacing, muttering to himself, his mind racing..

Come on, Will...think...think... Will moves to an exterior-facing TWENTY-FOOT WIDE PANORAM WINDOW, its CURTAINS drawn back like an elegant movie hou to reveal the skyline and fire raging five floors below. He spots an in-wall FIRE ALARM BOX -- its digital display flashes: OFFLINE. Will pulls the handle a couple times, nothing. He's fucked. Will tries to pry the Fire Alarm box off the wall, to get its innards, but without any luck. It's on there tight. It's then that Will spots something on the other side of panoramic window... WILL (cont'd) Hello, beautiful. Sitting directly opposite the fire alarm, on the exterior the building, is its CONTROL BOX resting there on the exposed fascia. He spots a METAL TRASH CAN and picks it u (CONTINUED)

Will slams the trash can against the panoramic window -- CLANG! Nothing. A chip maybe. Will tries again, no luck. WILL (cont'd) Damn it. Will moves down the PANORAMIC WINDOW, away from the FIRE ALARM until he comes to the window's end. He stops at an ADJACENT PANEL OF GLASS, just as tall but only about four-feet wide -- an easier target. Will presses on it with his hand, judging its thickness. Knowing now what it takes now, Will backs up and then charges: using the trash can like a battering ram -- WHAM

head_text.subj: INSTANTLY THE WHOLE SECTION SHATTERS INTO A MILLION PIECE

text: and Will's momentum carries him THROUGH THE OPENING!

He lets go of the trash can, barely managing to grab hold the WINDOW TRANSOM to keep from falling through completel Will gathers himself and scans the penthouse level. His eyes land on a BRONZE STATUE of a CHINESE WARRIOR resting a four-foot MARBLE PEDESTAL. He shoulders the pedestal sending the statue crashing. Th Warrior's HAND breaks free and in it a SIX-INCH SHORT-SWO ("Dao"). Will picks up the thin blade -- it'll do. He looks at the CURTAINS hanging to one side of the panoramic window. He yanks them down, quickly finding the BRAIDED CORD that the mechanism uses to retract them. Wil loops the cord around his elbow like a length of rope. Finished, Will knows he's still missing one more thing. H reaches for his belt and holds up the DUCT TAPE.
wrapped like a boxer's before a bout but with duct tape, STICKY SIDE OUT. Will finishes the last strip and tests h new hand adhesion by placing his palms together.
lying on its side at the foot of the shattered window pan One end of the curtain rope is tied around its the pedest the other end Will lashes around his waist, knotting it. (CONTINUED)

We see that Will has also duct taped his feet. He checks the stickiness of one, talking to himself... WILL (cont'd) Can never be too careful when you're doing something this stupid. Standing at the open window, the wind howling madly, noth but a three-thousand foot fall and certain death below hi Will steadies himself... WILL (cont'd) Kids, don't try this at home... ...and then he steps out, pivoting around the window transom. But his first step is a poorly place one and Wil stumbles, nearly falling. HE CLUTCHES THE TRANSOM AND PULLS HIMSELF BACK IN -- his life flashing before his eyes. Will lets out a little laugh -- nerves getting the better of him. Two steadying breaths and Will gives it another go. He pivots out stepping onto the SIX-INCH LEDGE that runs along the base of the panoramic window. Will presses his body as close as he can to the glass -- his duct taped ha sticking nicely to the window. Slide step by slide step, Will crosses the twenty-foot wi section of glass, eyeing the CONTROL BOX on the far side. Below him, the fire rages -- climbing ever-closer.
Being tended to by an EMT, Henry breaths through an oxyge mask as nearby Sarah sketches something for Chan.
It looked like this... Sarah flips around a clipboard to reveal a crude facsimil of the Black Lotus Triad tattoo. Chan and Han share a knowing look.
And how many of them did you say you saw?
Six. (CONTINUED)
Do you have any idea what they're doing up there? Why they're doing this?
No.
And you claim your husband isn't involved?
I don't claim that -- I'm telling you that. He's not involved. Lieutenant Han pulls his boss away for an aside, speaking Cantonese.

Captain -- this doesn't pass the smell test. None of it does. If the Black Lotus are there to get something -- to steal something -- why light the building on fire? And if they're trying to cover their tracks -- fine -- but why trap yourself above the fire line and then destroy your only means of escape? It doesn't make any sense. A sudden realization hits Sarah. She cuts in in Cantonese surprising the officers.
That's not their only means of escape.
Really? Then how are they planning to get out?
They're gonna jump.
Excuse me?
They're gonna jump off the top. When I saw them that first time, they had containers with them marked in Russian. (CONTINUED)
Sarah grabs a computer terminal. Types in the word for PARACHUTE then hits translate to Russian.

Pops up. She points at it. SARAH (cont'd) That's the word I saw on the container they had. Sarah moves to a WALL MAP of HONG KONG, scanning it. SARAH (cont'd) (to Han) Gimme your pen. The lieutenant hesitates, looking to Chan for the okay.
Give her your pen... He obliges and Sarah snags it, checking its length agains the map's scale legend. She marks an X on the map.
The Pearl is here. (beat) A base jump from a thousand meters up gives you about triple that in lateral descent distance -- call ita mile to be safe, two pen lengths.
How do you know that? She turns her phone's screen to them and shrugs...

I Googled it. The Captain shoots his Lieutenant a look: she got you the Sarah measures out two pen lengths from the X in all four directions, then connects the points with a crude circle. SARAH (cont'd) That's your search area. If they land, they'll land within that circle -- and if they have friends, they'll be waiting to pick them up at the landing zone. Someplace flat and open. (CONTINUED)
Impressed, Captain Chan moves closer to the map... Sarah points

And secluded. (scanning the map) They won't go for Victoria Park -- too obvious and too many trees to get hung up on. South, but you'd never clear the peak. West, maybe, but it's a longer haul to an open spot. Risky.
There. What's that -- on the other side of the harbor? The Kowloon side. to a BROWN RECTANGLE in the water.

That's nothing. It's a construction sand barge -- bay dredge. Sarah gives Chan a look. He's thinking. LIEUTENANT HAN (cont'd) Captain, you can't seriously be considering this. For all we know, she's in on it.
You think I'd willingly trap my own children in a burning building?
I think you could be playing a role. You could be a distraction to allow your husband to escape. This could all be part of his plan. Sarah can't believe this guy. She turns to Chan...

Captain, I know you wanna get this right and the last thing you want to do is to point your gun at the wrong guy. (beat) Take me out to the sand barge. If it's empty and I'm wrong, what have you lost? But if I'm right, it might be your only chance to catch the men responsible for this whole thing. (CONTINUED)

Captain Chan considers this. He's about to respond when suddenly there's a RUMBLING FROM THE CROWD OUTSIDE. Something's going on. Chan breaks for the trailer's exit door, followed by Lieutenant Han and Sarah.

The trio come to a stop just outside the trailer. They stare at the HD BILLBOARD, stunned. ON SCREEN, we see long-lens news footage of Will inching across the PANORAMIC WINDOW, nearly a mile above them. They turn from the giant video screen and look up with th own eyes to see Will's ant-like form, clinging to the sid the building -- an insane act. The act of a desperate man
Captain, does that look like someone with a plan to you? Chan glances at Sarah -- his wheels turning.

220 stories above the earth, Will presses himself against the glass, inches from his goal. One more step. Will makes the step --BOOM!-- a glass panel on the floor below him explodes like a car bomb. Will lunges for the control box, clutching it to keep fro falling. Two more explosions rock the tower from below. Will finds footing around the box. He reaches into his waistband and pulls out the statue's sword, wedging it in the seams of the box, prying at it. With a crack, it pops open and Will goes to work on the wiring. He finds what he's looking for -- a GOLD WIRE. Using the statue sword, Will strips the wire, cuts anothe one, and hot-wires them together. A GREEN LIGHT on the conduit panel turns off and a RED LIGHT starts FLASHING.
on the other side of the panoramic window flashes the wor FIRE-FIRE-FIRE.  97.
The CONTROL PANEL next to the PENTHOUSE DOORS flashes the same: FIRE-FIRE-FIRE. With a heavy metal CHUNK, the TITANIUM DOORS UNLOCK AND SLOWLY START TO SWING OPEN.
The panel by Zhao's bed blinks: FIRE-FIRE-FIRE. Zhao pull open his nightstand drawer snatches up a PALM-SIZED BERET NANO -- an executive's gun meant to be concealed. Zhao exits.

Zhao rounds the corner to see the front doors to his penthouse wide open. He moves to the nearest control pane and tries to shut the doors, but the programming won't al it -- the fire alarm overrides his controls. Thinking fast, Zhao pulls his smartphone out of his pocke snags a nearby USB cable and plugs his phone directly int the panel itself. He starts thumbing away like mad.

Will lets go of the control box and begins to make his wa back across the panoramic window, slide step by sli -- BO A DEAFENING EXPLOSION rattles the world. Will falls. Everything goes topsy-turvy as we plummet. Suddenly, we'r jerked to stop as Will's securing rope snaps taught. That's the good news. The bad news is that the sudden force of the fall has cau Will's securing rope to slip down his body -- coming to a snug cinch point around the ankle of Will's prosthetic le Fire raging around him, Will dangles upside down by his ankle, a mile up, like a rabbit caught in a rope snare.
is yanked against the window frame at a poor angle, wedgi itself against the transom in anything but a secure fashi (CONTINUED)

Swinging upside down, Will gets his bearings. He tries to curl his body up toward the rope -- like a hanging sit-up but the added strain of the move causes his prosthetic sleeve to loosen -- WILL'S LEG IS SLIPPING OUT OF IT. Will falls back, dangling by a leg that's coming loose. Like a car teetering on the edge of a cliff, any movement from Will might cause his leg to come undone completely. The earth a postage stamp below him, Will steadies himsel becoming as still as possible, barely daring to breathe. Will knows he's going to have one shot at this. He gather his courage and makes one sharp move. With a grunt, he breaks into action using his free leg to kick off the face of the building while throwing his hand toward his toes, propelling himself upward with such forc that his RESIDUAL LIMB POPS OUT OF THE PROSTHESIS.

For a blink, Will is in complete free fall -- no rope, no leg -- but his hands snag hold of the CARBON FIBER FEMUR the last possible second. A strange sight indeed: a one-legged man, clinging to a metal leg, attached to a rope, 3,000 feet in the air. Will starts pulling with everything he's got. A dead-hang rope climb. The weight of this undulating action causes
to strain against the window transom, inching closer and closer to dislodging completely.
free-climbs for all he's worth, hand-over-hand, a man of undying determination: his arms burning, but his eyes focused on the open window ledge ten feet above him.

At the control panel for the doors, Zhao has used his smartphone to hack bypass the fire alarm function and he instructs the doors to reset. Zhao jabs the "SECURE DOORS" button the panel and watches the titanium Goliaths lurch toward each other. Zhao takes cover behind a LOW CABINET, checking his mini- Beretta, ready to plug anyone who comes through the door.  99.

Will's forearm slaps over the marble pedestal. He pulls himself up and over the final hurdle. Exhausted, Will collapses. But only for a moment as he suddenly sees the penthouse doors closing -- he's only go seconds before they shut again, sealing him out for good. Leaping into action, Will starts pulling up the rope, his prosthesis dangling on the other end like fish on a hook. Just then, another explosion from below rocks the penthou floor causing the marble pedestal to break free and plumm through the window like an anchor. The cord rips through Will's duct-taped hands, smoking th as Will's prosthesis whips back to him like a boomerang. Will clutches his leg as it's being pulled from his grip the four-hundred pound pedestal on other end of the rope. Will glances back at the penthouse doors -- they're almos closed now: he's gotta make a choice his leg or the door. But Will makes a third play: he pulls the statue's sword from his waistband and cuts the rope with one downward ha The rope whips through the window opening as Will tumbles back, his prosthetic leg in his hand. Will jams his leg into the PROSTHETIC SLEEVE and spins to see the penthouse doors a foot from sealing shut. Will bolts for them, diving into a head-first slide on hi side -- like a car up on two wheels -- and narrowly SKIMS THROUGH THE OPENING. He made it. Only, he didn't. Will's PROSTHETIC ANKLE is caught in the door like a bear trap. Will tugs on it with both hands, it won't budge. With one final pull, Will yanks his leg through the doors which quickly seal shut behind him, tumbling back into a heap on the foyer. Then:
Don't move. Will looks up to see Zhao pointing his tiny Beretta a foo from Will's nose. Will's shoulders slump at his luck. (CONTINUED)
You're too close. What an odd thing to say. Zhao doesn't follow...
What?
You're...

With cat-like quickness, Will slaps the Beretta out of th inexperienced billionaire's hands as he yanks Zhao's wris downward and simultaneously sweeps his leg, dropping him the polished floor -- a slick-ass take down. WILL (cont'd) ...too close. Will pounces on him, driving the point of his good knee between Zhao's shoulder-blades, pinning him there. WILL (cont'd) We need to talk.

head_text.subj: A SMALL MAN IN A SHARP SUIT.

text: Tan, salt & pepper hair. Bushy eyebrows. Capped teeth. A Chinese Martin Scorsese. This is WU-SAI JUN, kingpin and crime lord of Hong Kong. He smiles at us.
I know this is difficult. We're...

Opulent, dark. The den of a powerful man. Zhao sits oppos Jun. Xia sprawls on a nearby chaise as Feng looms in view Behind Jun, the most striking feature: a wall comprised o GLASS TERRARIUMS, each containing a solitary SNAKE.
For a man like you, this must come with some discomfort. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) But you can take solace in the fact that it's all for a greater good. The glory of The Middle Kingdom.
Forgive me, but I don't see how extortion glorifies China.
This isn't extortion, Mr. Zhao, this is business.
And if I refuse? Wu-Sai Jun smiles. This man might take more convincing. H rises from this seat moving toward the back wall of snake

There are ten snakes in the world to which there exists no known antivenom. (re: the terrarium wall) I've made a home here for each one. Jun slides out one particular terrarium from the wall lik drawer in a bureau. The BLACK & BLUE STRIPED SNAKE inside it coils, ready to strike. WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) The snake handlers of Burma practice an ancient art called Mithridatism. He opens the top of glass box. The snake hisses, a warnin WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) They believed that by ingesting small amounts of a snake's poison over time, they would become one with the animal, rendering its venom harmless. Jun rolls up his sleeve, revealing his BLACK LOTUS TRIAD TATTOO. He places his arm in the terrarium, holding it there in front of the hissing reptile but never taking hi eyes from Zhao. WU-SAI JUN (cont'd) The Blue Krait's venom has been used for centuries by indigenous Malaysian tribes to hunt big game. It's said a single bite can stop an elephant's heart in under ninety seconds. (CONTINUED)
